title: Client just ... uninstalled itself ._. ?
body: So today i tried to open the client and play the new assasins . it did not want to open (error ) so i just ignored it and opened the regular client,, and the alpha client dissapeared from my desktop ._. is this because of the new assasin update or no ?

replies.body:
Hey everyone, there's a bit of confusion here that I'm going to try to address. 6.22 is the open beta patch for the League client update. For players who are already on the alpha, [they'll be automatically upgrading](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/230175788#h1q9) to beta as they patch to 6.22 using the updated client. Part of this process includes replacing the legacy desktop icon with the new updated icon. This does NOT remove the legacy client files, only the icon.

Players who are still using the legacy client, will have a chance to upgrade their client when we enable open beta which will install the updated client on their system, update their desktop icon but will NOT remove the legacy client files. 

Now, we're tracking reports of weird behavior around launching the legacy client from the login screen of the updated client that's causing clients to break etc. This is not intended behavior and we'll be fixing this asap.

Ok apparently User Access Control on Windows (the pop up thing that asks you if you want to confirm changes) is actually preventing the alpha from updating your alpha client icon which ends up just removing it from your desktop. This will be fixed once we go to open beta but in the time being, the workaround is locating the LeagueClient executable in your install folder and create a shortcut from there.

You can also right click the client and select "Create Shortcut" to create a new Shortcut Icon to the Client which you can then cut and paste to your desktop.
